titleproper.value:
Guide to the John Ricci Papers
                    <num>MC 156</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jackie Rider.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2013-03-14T15:21-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection contains photographs, memorabilia, and correspondence relating to John Ricci's tenure as a professor of chemistry at New York University.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known), John Ricci Papers, MC 156, folder number, New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

He wrote more than 70 research articles, most in the 
                <emph render="italic">Journal of the American Chemical Society</emph>. He also authored two books: 
                <emph render="italic">The Phase Rule and Heterogeneous Equilibrium</emph> and 
                <emph render="italic">Hydrogen Ion Concentration, New Concepts in a Systematic Treatment.</emph>

The collection consists primarily of photographs taken during and honoring Ricci's teaching career at New York University. Most are of Department of Chemistry faculty and students. Included are some photos of the University Heights Campus. The collection also contains items from Ricci's student days at NYU during the 1920s and correspondence related to Ricci's appointment to several New York City councils and academic honorary societies.

subject.value: New York University. University Heights Campus.

corpname.value: Phi Beta Kappa. Alpha of New York (New York University).
